content.text:
Based on the commits from the last 2 weeks on the main branch, here's a summary of what was implemented:

## Major Features

**1. CLI Deprecation & Web Migration**
- Deprecated the CLI in favor of the web application
- Added deprecation notices to guide users to the web version
- Fixed CLI entrypoint issues during the transition

**2. Employee Mode Implementation**
- Added employee mode with floating toggle and authentication
- Implemented proper employee mode reset functionality
- Enhanced admin capabilities for internal team usage

**3. App Deletion System**
- Complete app deletion functionality with cascading cleanup
- Delete UI with confirmation modals in admin interface
- Support for deleting both Koyeb and DBX apps
- Added filtering and restoration capabilities for deleted apps
- GitHub repository archiving as part of deletion process

**4. DBX Deployment Support**
- Added DBX deployment support with prompt-based development
- Enhanced deployment status tracking in database

## Infrastructure & Reliability Improvements

**5. Deployment & Operations**
- Asynchronous Koyeb organization deletion
- Improved deactivation status checking
- Fixed ECR registry conflicts
- Enhanced deployment status tracking
- Increased max retry attempts for operations

**6. UI/UX Enhancements**
- Added BETA badge to Laravel framework
- Various styling fixes and improvements
- Title truncation for better display
- Loading state improvements

The focus over the past 2 weeks has been primarily on **transitioning away from the CLI to a web-based experience**, implementing **comprehensive app deletion capabilities**, and adding **employee-specific features** for better internal tooling. There's also been significant work on **DBX integration** and various **infrastructure reliability improvements**.

message.content: Im adding this to slack, anything you would have changed to make it look better?

Im adding this to slack, anything you would have changed to make it look better? :siren-flare: app.build changelog:
CLI Deprecation
Released a final CLI version with a big deprecation notice and guide the users to the web version
Deprecated all  npm versions bellow 2.0 (it's on 1.33.1) currently
Employee Mode 
Added a small toggle to the UI, that allows you to "impersonate" an employee/non-employee easily (only available for employees)
App Deletion System
Added app deletion for both Koyeb and Databricks Apps
Added app deletion in Admin, so we can delete any app easily
Databricks Apps Deployment Support
It's now possible to deploy apps into Databricks Apps, although, only the NiceGUI stack is currently supported for those
This is only available for employees

content.text:
Your changelog looks good! Here are a few suggestions to make it more polished for Slack:

**Formatting improvements:**
- Use bullet points (`‚Ä¢` or `-`) for better readability
- Add emojis for visual appeal
- Make the structure more consistent

**Suggested version:**

```
üö® app.build changelog:

**üö´ CLI Deprecation**
‚Ä¢ Released final CLI version with deprecation notice guiding users to web version
‚Ä¢ Deprecated all npm versions below 2.0 (currently on 1.33.1)

**üë• Employee Mode**
‚Ä¢ Added UI toggle for employees to easily switch between employee/non-employee views
‚Ä¢ Streamlines testing and support workflows

**üóëÔ∏è App Deletion System**
‚Ä¢ Full app deletion support for both Koyeb and Databricks Apps
‚Ä¢ Admin interface now includes app deletion capabilities with confirmation modals
‚Ä¢ Includes GitHub repository archiving and cascading cleanup

**üöÄ Databricks Apps Deployment**
‚Ä¢ New deployment target: Databricks Apps (employee-only feature)
‚Ä¢ Currently supports NiceGUI stack with more coming soon
```

**Key changes:**
- Added emojis for visual hierarchy
- Made bullet points consistent
- Clarified "impersonate" ‚Üí "switch between views" 
- Added context about confirmation modals and cleanup
- Mentioned "more coming soon" for Databricks to show ongoing development
